name: Koala Ops
headline: A platform for developing microservices on Kubernetes
description:
We make running services on Kubernetes as easy as Heroku, but on your cloud and with all the flexibility and power of Kubernetes. Companies use Koala so that they don't have to hire dedicated infrastructure engineers.

Although 50-70% of organizations have already adopted Kubernetes, most developers agree that it is too complex and difficult to manage. It is intended to be extremely flexible in order to solve pretty much everyone’s needs, but it can take a ton of work and many auxiliary tools to get there.

As companies grow, they spend a lot on DevOps or Platform Engineers that try to reduce the burden on developers by gluing together all the 3p tools via custom internal tools.

We are building an “internal developer platform” out of the box, with best practices and golden paths for building and operating services on Kubernetes.

We do the research on the latest and greatest tools in the extremely vibrant ecosystem, and automatically integrate for you the tools you want to use.

We operate on our customers code and in your Cloud environment, so they never locked in and never restricted, as is common with classic PaaS offerings.

If you prefer a fully hosted environment like Heroku, Fly or Vercel, we’ll host a cluster for you and offer you a one-click migration to your own cluster when you want.

**Koala Ops: Simplifying Kubernetes for Developers**

Founded in 2022 and born out of Y Combinator's Batch W23, Koala Ops is on a mission to streamline the development of microservices on Kubernetes. Headquartered in Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, this emerging player is tackling a known pain point in the developer community: the complexity of Kubernetes.

### The Challenge

Even with significant adoption—50-70% of organizations are utilizing Kubernetes—developers frequently find themselves wrestling with its intricacies. The promise of flexibility to meet diverse needs can quickly turn into chaos as teams juggle various tools and configurations. This often leads to organizations hiring costly DevOps or Platform Engineers to manage their environments. 

### The Koala Solution

Koala Ops aims to change that. The platform offers an “internal developer platform” right out of the box, complete with industry best practices and guided paths for service building and operation. By automating the integration of various tools, Koala Ops lets developers focus on writing code rather than battling with infrastructure setup.

A key differentiator is that Koala Ops integrates seamlessly with existing code and operates within the customer’s cloud environment. This means no lock-in to a single provider or heavy investments in proprietary platforms—akin to the ease of services like Heroku, but with the full power of Kubernetes.

### Features and Benefits

Koala Ops shines by offering:

- **Automated DevOps**: It streamlines CI/CD processes and environment management, reducing the friction during deployments.
- **Tool Integration**: The platform orchestrates leading DevOps tools, making it easy to integrate with your existing cloud setups and observability platforms.
- **Customization Without Lock-in**: You choose the tools you want to use, all while maintaining full control of your infrastructure.
- **Scalable Infrastructure**: Designed to grow alongside your needs, whether you're a startup or a large enterprise.

### How it Works

Koala Ops allows users to get started quickly by integrating into their existing Kubernetes architecture or by configuring a new setup. The automation of CI/CD pipelines, along with the monitoring and incident management systems, simplifies both scaling and cost optimization efforts.

### Customer Testimonials

Customers have reported significant improvements in their operational efficiency:
- **Javier Roberts**, Co-Founder & CTO of Rio Digital Asset Brokerage, noted how Koala Ops enabled them to scale to 30 microservices without needing dedicated DevOps resources.
- **Maxim Donde**, Director of R&D at Brandbow, shared that the platform's ease of use and robust features significantly cut down their time to market.

### Conclusion

Koala Ops is not just another tool—it's a dedicated effort to make Kubernetes manageable for developers. By ensuring that teams can focus on building their products without being bogged down by infrastructure concerns, Koala Ops is positioning itself as a game-changer in the DevOps landscape.

For more information, check out [Koala Ops](https://koalaops.com/) and discover how they can help you automate DevOps with their internal developer platform.
